definition: lit. old account/old debt/fig. old scores to settle/old quarrels/old grudge

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
account/bill/debt/CL:本[ben3],筆|笔[bi3]
to turn over old accounts/fig. to revive old quarrels/to reopen old wounds

sentences.english: It is no use raking over the past, let us look ahead to the future.
sentences.chinese: 翻老账没用，让我们向前看眼望未来吧。

sentences.english: Let bygones be bygones, Don't dig up the past.
sentences.chinese: 让过去的过去吧，不要翻老账。

sentences.english: Japan still carries a lot of old diplomatic baggage in Asia.
sentences.chinese: 日本在亚洲的外交关系有厚厚一笔老账要翻。

sentences.english: I have some old scores to settle with that fellow.
sentences.chinese: 我和那家伙有些老账要清算。

definition: lit. old account/old debt/fig. old scores to settle/old quarrels/old grudge
accounts in a rotten state
old debt
lit. settling accounts after the autumn harvest (idiom); to wait until the time is ripe to settle accounts/to bide time for revenge
old grievance/former complaint
undisclosed account/to settle matters later/to blame sb after the event
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
old court case/long-standing legal dispute
to write off at one stroke
muddled accounts/a mess of bookkeeping
debt of blood (after killing sb)
to turn over old accounts/fig. to revive old quarrels/to reopen old wounds
(accounting) to balance the books/to do the accounts/(fig.) to settle an account/to get one's revenge
debt of blood (after killing sb)
loan settled (business term)/business complete to the satisfaction of both parties
to own up to a fault/to admit the truth/to acknowledge a debt
